** Carnage only grumbled in response to Teltoli's, "Good night." A quick 
reaction from someone who was basically asleep and only in a stage where 
they either grumble or groan to any stray sound that resembles words. It 
worked for her!
She slept peacefully through the night until her internal clock went off 
just before dawn, which singled her eyes to crack open and look towards the 
treetops to see that the sky was just turning a deep shade of purple from 
navy blue.
Carnage felt her structure and joints ache and remembered what Teltoli had 
said about getting old, thinking that she just might be turning the corner 
to that road where she would have to hang up her gun at the end.
But she wasn't done for yet and had tones more years left in her, but he 
joints did hurt like the Pit this morning!
What she would give for a nice warm...soft...bed, but it was waiting for her 
back at home so she only hand a day or two until her dream became reality.
Sighing she lifted her head and felt her neck complain, ignoring it and 
getting to her feet. Shaking them out and then her whole body to ease her 
joints and muscles from the night chill.
Carnage looked out into the forest. Through the night the rain had stopped 
and a mist had crept into the woods, still very visible but would disappear 
as the sun rose and the air warmed. But the fog worked perfectly for what 
she had in mind for the first day of complete Hell for the fuzor, which 
would end in Teltoli's final decision. This day would decide if she stood 
her ground...or walked away.
She looked down at the sleeping cat with a growl but was soft enough not to 
wake the teen up, since she would need all of the sleep she could get for 
what was ahead. The pain and stress could really take it out of a bot, 
especially one that grew up on a classy way of life and didn't know the 
meaning of REAL work.
Carnage shifted herself for a second before she moved off into the forest, 
transforming into robot mode and disappearing into the fog. On mornings like 
this she enjoyed being alone, with her mind and with nothing else but the 
wild by her side. She would return to Teltoli's side but only after a bit, 
besides, she would find her when she awoke.
She moved a little deeper into the woods before stopping in a rather 
cluttered area of the brush, listening to the sounds of the forest. Looking 
around and scanning for any enemies or creatures, which could pose problems, 
she sat down where she stood and crossed her legs. Leaning an elbow on each 
knee she ceased the scan and closed her optics, willing her tech muscles to 
relax so that her mind would follow their example. This was the time she 
loved most, where dawn was hours away but night was retreating, as the same 
was for evening and the night. It was all wonderful and held a sense of 
magic, almost as if one could see the pulse of this world as it's molten 
core beat life into it.**
